intro: Hieracium praetensum, commonly known as the purple meadowhawk, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers are yellow with a purple center, and it produces small, hairy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Hieracium praetensum is often found in open habitats and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with the right conditions.
